notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an unauthorized person or process to eavesdrop, view or modify data, gain system access, perform code execution, install unauthorized software, or affect system data integrity to negatively impact system confidentiality, integrity, or availability.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Healthcare and Public Health
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: Worldwide
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: Netherlands
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities, such as:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as virtual private networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploitation specifically targeting these vulnerabilities has been reported to CISA at this time.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: A third-party product component writes data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips recommends the following mitigations:

For vulnerabilities CVE-2020-36518, CVE-2020-11113, CVE-2020-35728, CVE-2021-20190, CVE-2020-14061, CVE-2020-10673, CVE-2019-12814, CVE-2017-17485, CVE-2023-40223, and CVE-2023-40159, Philips recommends upgrading to the latest Vue PACS version 12.2.8.400* released in August 2023.

For managed services customers, new releases will be made available upon resource availability. Releases are subject to country specific regulations. Users with questions regarding their specific Philips Vue PACS installations and new release eligibility should contact their local Philips Sales representative or submit a request in the Philips Informatics Support portal.
Refer to the Philips advisory for more details.

notes.text: A third-party product component deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently verifying that the resulting data will be valid.

notes.text: A third-party product component does not properly control the allocation and maintenance of CPU use upon receiving a large invalid packet frame.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips recommends the following mitigations:

For CVE-2021-28165, Philips recommends configuring the Vue PACS environment per D000763414 – Vue_PACS_12_Ports_Protocols_Services_Guide available on Incenter. Philips also recommends upgrading to the Vue PACS version 12.2.8.410* released in October 2023.

For managed services customers, new releases will be made available upon resource availability. Releases are subject to country specific regulations. Users with questions regarding their specific Philips Vue PACS installations and new release eligibility should contact their local Philips Sales representative or submit a request in the Philips Informatics Support portal.
Refer to the Philips advisory for more details.

notes.text: Philips Vue PACS does not properly assign, modify, track, or check actor privileges, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips recommends the following mitigations:

For vulnerabilities CVE-2020-36518, CVE-2020-11113, CVE-2020-35728, CVE-2021-20190, CVE-2020-14061, CVE-2020-10673, CVE-2019-12814, CVE-2017-17485, CVE-2023-40223, and CVE-2023-40159, Philips recommends upgrading to the latest Vue PACS version 12.2.8.400* released in August 2023.

For managed services customers, new releases will be made available upon resource availability. Releases are subject to country specific regulations. Users with questions regarding their specific Philips Vue PACS installations and new release eligibility should contact their local Philips Sales representative or submit a request in the Philips Informatics Support portal.
Refer to the Philips advisory for more details.

notes.text: Philips Vue PACS uses default credentials for potentially critical functionality.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips recommends the following mitigations:
For CVE-2023-40704 and CVE-2023-40539, Philips recommends configuring the Vue PACS environment per 8G7607 – Vue PACS User Guide Rev G available on Incenter.

For managed services customers, new releases will be made available upon resource availability. Releases are subject to country specific regulations. Users with questions regarding their specific Philips Vue PACS installations and new release eligibility should contact their local Philips Sales representative or submit a request in the Philips Informatics Support portal.
Refer to the Philips advisory for more details.

notes.text: Philips Vue PACS does not require that users have strong passwords, which could make it easier for attackers to compromise user accounts.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips recommends the following mitigations:
For CVE-2023-40704 and CVE-2023-40539, Philips recommends configuring the Vue PACS environment per 8G7607 – Vue PACS User Guide Rev G available on Incenter.

Users with questions regarding their specific Philips Vue PACS installations and new release eligibility should contact their local Philips Sales representative or submit a request in the Philips Informatics Support portal.
Refer to the Philips advisory for more details.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A validated user not explicitly authorized to have access to certain sensitive information could access Philips Vue PACS on the same network to expose that information.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips recommends the following mitigations:

For vulnerabilities CVE-2020-36518, CVE-2020-11113, CVE-2020-35728, CVE-2021-20190, CVE-2020-14061, CVE-2020-10673, CVE-2019-12814, CVE-2017-17485, CVE-2023-40223, and CVE-2023-40159, Philips recommends upgrading to the latest Vue PACS version 12.2.8.400* released in August 2023.

For managed services customers, new releases will be made available upon resource availability. Releases are subject to country specific regulations. Users with questions regarding their specific Philips Vue PACS installations and new release eligibility should contact their local Philips Sales representative or submit a request in the Philips Informatics Support portal.
Refer to the Philips advisory for more details.
